en: This is Rich Kleinfeldt.
And this is Sarah Long with THE MAKING OF A NATION,
zh: 这里是莎拉 · 朗为您带来的《建立一个国家》

en: a VOA Special English program about the history of the United States.
zh: 美国之音关于美国历史的特别英语节目。

en: Today, we tell about early Native Americans.
zh: 今天，我们讲述早期的美洲原住民。

en: Scientists believe that
the native peoples of America
came here thousands of years ago
during the last ice age.
These people settled the land
from the cold northern areas
to the extreme end of South America.
As the groups of people settled
different parts of the land,
they developed their own languages,
zh: 他们发展了自己的语言,

en: their own cultures and their own religions.
zh: 他们自己的文化和宗教。

en: Each group's story is important
in the history of the Americas.
However, it is perhaps
the tribes of the central part of the United States
that are most recognized.
They will be our story today.
zh: 他们将是我们今天的故事。

en: In 1804, Merriwether Lewis and William Clark
zh: 1804年，梅里韦瑟 · 刘易斯和威廉 · 克拉克

en: led a group of explorers to the Pacific Ocean.
zh: 带领一队探险家前往太平洋。

en: They were the first educated Americans
zh: 他们是第一批受过教育的美国人

en: to see some of the native tribes of the Great Plains.
zh: 去看看大平原上的一些土著部落。

en: And they were the first white people
these Native American people had ever seen.
zh: 这些印第安人从未见过。

en: When the group of explorers neared
the eastern side of the great Rocky Mountains,
they met with a tribe of Indians called the Shoshoni.
zh: 他们遇到了一个叫 Shoshoni 的印第安部落。

en: Merriwether Lewis was the first to see them.
zh: 梅里韦瑟 · 刘易斯是第一个见到他们的人。

en: Let us imagine
we are with Merriwether Lewis
zh: 我们和梅里韦瑟 · 刘易斯在一起

en: near the Rocky Mountains almost two hundred years ago.
Across a small hill,
a group of sixty Shoshoni men are riding toward us.
zh: 一群六十个肖肖尼人正向我们骑来。

en: The first thing we see is that
these men are ready for war.
zh: 这些人已经准备好开战了。

en: Each is armed with a bow and arrows.
Some carry long poles
with a sharp knife on the end.
They are riding very fast.
Some horses seem to be without riders.
But a closer look shows that
the men are hanging off the sides,
or under the horse’s neck.
They are using the horses' bodies as protection.
zh: 他们用马的身体作为保护。

en: The horses are painted
with many different designs
that use blue, black, red or other colors.
zh: 使用蓝色，黑色，红色或其他颜色。

en: Later we learn that
each design has a special meaning
zh: 每个设计都有特殊的含义

en: for the man who owns the horse.
zh: 对于拥有这匹马的人来说。

en: Each one tells a story.
For example,
the man riding one horse
is a leader during battle.
Another has killed an enemy in battle.
zh: 另一个在战斗中杀死了一个敌人。

en: One of the designs
protects the horse and rider.
As they come nearer,
the Shoshoni group sees that
zh: Shoshoni 集团看到了这一点

en: we are not ready for war.
They slow their horses
but are still very careful.
Merriwether Lewis holds up a open hand
zh: 梅里韦瑟 · 刘易斯举起了一只张开的手

en: as a sign of peace.
The leader of the Shoshoni
does the same.
They come closer.
The Shoshoni are dressed in clothes
made from animal skin.
Most of these skins
are from deer or the American buffalo.
zh: 都是鹿或者美洲野牛造成的。

en: The shirts they wear
have many designs,
and tell stories
like the designs on the horses.
One shows a man
has fought in a battle.
Another shows a man
has been in many raids to capture horses.
zh: 在许多突击搜捕马匹的行动中。

en: Still another shows the man
saved the life of a friend.
Captain Lewis smiles at these men.
zh: 路易斯上尉对这些人微笑。

en: He again makes a hand sign
that means peace.
The signs are now returned.
Lewis and the Shoshoni chief
cannot speak each other's language.
They can communicate using hand signs.
One young Shoshoni man comes near.
zh: 一个年轻的 Shoshoni 人走近。

en: He drops to the ground from his horse.
He is tall and looks strong.
His hair is black in color and long.
zh: 他的头发是黑色的，很长。

en: He wears one long bird feather
zh: 他戴着一根长长的鸟羽毛

en: in the back of his hair.
Some of his hair
is held in place by animal fur.
His arms have been painted
with long lines.
We learn that each line
represents a battle.
There are many lines.
But we leave the Shoshoni
without him adding another one.
The Shoshoni were only one of many tribes of native people
zh: Shoshoni 人只是许多土著部落中的一个

en: who lived in the Great Plains area.
The life, culture and society of these tribes developed
zh: 这些部落的生活、文化和社会得到了发展

en: because of the land that was their home.
zh: 因为这片土地曾是他们的家园。

en: The Great Plains today is still huge.
zh: 今天的大平原依然很大。

en: Even in a car,
traveling at one hundred kilometers an hour,
it can take two long days of driving
to cross the Great Plains.
The plains reach
from several hundred kilometers north in Canada
zh: 来自加拿大北部几百公里处

en: across the middle of the continent
to Mexico in the south.
In the East,
the Great Plains begin
near the Mississippi River
and go west to the huge Rocky Mountains.
zh: 然后向西走到巨大的落基山脉。

en: It is the center of the United States.
There are big rivers here, deserts and mountains.
zh: 这里有大河，沙漠和山脉。

en: Other areas are so flat that
a person can see for hundreds of kilometers.
zh: 一个人可以看到几百公里远的东西。

en: Millions of kilometers of this land
were once covered by a thick ocean of grass.
zh: 曾经被茂密的草海所覆盖。

en: The grass provided food for an animal
that made possible the culture of the Indians of the Great Plains.
zh: 使得大平原印第安人的文化成为可能。

en: The grass fed the bison,
the American buffalo.
The buffalo was the center of
native Indian culture in the Great Plains.
zh: 大平原上的印第安土著文化。

en: The huge animal provided meat for the Indians.
zh: 这种巨大的动物为印第安人提供肉食。

en: But it was much more than just food.
It was an important part of the religion
zh: 这是宗教的重要组成部分

en: of most of the native people in the Great Plains.
zh: 大平原上的大多数土著居民。

en: The Lakota tribe is one of the people of the Great Plains.
zh: 拉科塔部落是大平原上的一个民族。

en: The Lakota are sometimes called the Sioux.
zh: 拉科塔人有时被称为苏族人。

en: They believed that
everything necessary to life was within the buffalo.
zh: 生命所需的一切都在水牛体内。

en: Another Plains tribe,
the Blackfeet, called the animal
"My home and my protection."
The back of the huge buffalo
provided thick skin
that was used to make homes for the Plains Indians.
zh: 用来为平原印第安人建造家园。

en: Other parts were made into clothing.
Still other parts became warm blankets.
zh: 还有一些部分变成了温暖的毯子。

en: Buffalo bones were made into tools.
zh: 水牛的骨头被制成工具。

en: Nothing of the animal was wasted.
zh: 动物的一切都没有被浪费。

en: No one knows how many buffalo
zh: 没人知道有多少头水牛

en: were in North America
when Merriwether Lewis first met the Shoshoni.
zh: 当梅里韦瑟 · 刘易斯第一次遇见肖肖尼人的时候。

en: But experts say it was probably
between sixty million to seventy-five million.
zh: 在六千万到七千五百万之间。

en: Another animal also helped make possible
zh: 另一种动物也帮助实现了

en: the Indian cultures of the Great Plains.
Native Americans first
called these animals mystery dogs,
zh: 称这些动物为神秘的狗,

en: or big dogs.
They had no word
for this animal in their language.
zh: 用他们的语言描述这种动物。

en: We know it as the horse.
No horses existed in North America
before the Spanish arrived in the 1500s
zh: 在16世纪西班牙人到来之前

en: in what is now the southern part of the United States.
Native peoples hunted,
moved and traveled by foot.
Traveling long distances was difficult,
so was hunting buffalo.
The horse greatly changed the life
zh: 那匹马极大地改变了生活

en: of all the people of the Great Plains.
It gave them a method of travel.
zh: 这给了他们一种旅行的方式。

en: It provided a way
to carry food and equipment.
It made it easier and safer
to follow and hunt the buffalo.
The horse made it possible
zh: 那匹马让这一切成为可能

en: to attack an enemy far away and return safely.
zh: 攻击远方的敌人并安全返回。

en: The number of horses owned
became the measure of a tribe's wealth.
zh: 成为衡量一个部落财富的标准。

en: Spanish settlers rode horses
to the small town of Santa Fe
in what is now the southwestern state of New Mexico.
zh: 现在是新墨西哥州的西南部。

en: They arrived there in about the year 1609.
zh: 他们大约在1609年到达那里。

en: It is not known
how native peoples in Santa Fe
zh: 圣达菲的原住民怎么样

en: got the first horses in the country.
zh: 得到了全国第一批马匹。

en: Perhaps they traded for them.
Perhaps they captured them in an attack.
zh: 也许他们在一次袭击中抓住了他们。

en: Many tribes soon were trading
zh: 许多部落很快就开始了贸易

en: and capturing horses.
By the 1750s,
all the tribes of the Great Plains had horses.
zh: 大平原上所有的部落都有马。

en: They had become experts at raising,
zh: 他们已经成为养育孩子的专家,

en: training and riding horses.
They became experts at horse medicine.
Each Indian of the Great Plains could
zh: 大平原上的每个印第安人都可以

en: ride a horse by the age of five.
As an adult,
a young man would have a special horse for work.
zh: 一个年轻人会有一匹特殊的马来工作。

en: Another horse would be trained for hunting.
zh: 另一匹马将被训练用来打猎。

en: And another would be trained for war.
zh: 而另一个将会接受战争训练。

en: An Indian warrior's success
depended upon how closely
he and his horses worked together.
George Catlin was an artist
who traveled a great deal
in the early American west.
He painted many beautiful pictures of American Indians.
zh: 他画了许多美丽的美国美洲原住民。

en: Mr.Catlin said the Plains Indian
zh: 卡特林先生说平原印第安人

en: was the greatest horse rider
the world has ever known.
He said the moment
an Indian rider laid a hand on his horse
zh: 一个印度骑手把一只手放在他的马上

en: he became part of the animal.
zh: 他变成了动物的一部分。

en: The buffalo and horse were
extremely important to the Plains Indian.
zh: 对平原印第安人极其重要。

en: Because the horse made hunting easier,
zh: 因为马让狩猎变得更容易,

en: more time could be spent on things like art.
zh: 可以把更多的时间花在像艺术这样的事情上。

en: The Plains Indians began to
make designs on their clothing,
zh: 在他们的衣服上设计图案,

en: and on special blankets their horses wore.
zh: 他们的马匹穿着特殊的毛毯。

en: Even common objects were painted with designs.
zh: 即使是普通的物品也被画上了图案。

en: The coming of white settlers to the Great Plains
was the beginning of the end
of the buffalo and horse culture of the American Indians.
zh: 水牛和马文化的美国美洲原住民。

en: Settlers did not want buffalo
destroying their crops.
The buffalo were killed.
By the year 1885,
the Indians of the Great Plains
were mostly restricted to
area of land called reservations.
zh: 称为保留地的土地面积。

en: Many of the Great Plains tribes
that survive today
work hard to keep their traditional cultures.
zh: 努力保持他们的传统文化。

en: They produce art, music, and clothing.
zh: 他们创作艺术、音乐和服装。

en: They keep alive the memory of these people
zh: 他们让这些人的记忆永存

en: who added greatly to the history of America.
zh: 他为美国历史添砖加瓦。

en: This MAKING OF A NATION program
was written by Paul Thompson.
zh: 是保罗 · 汤普森写的。

en: This is Sarah Long.
And this is Rich Kleinfeldt.
Join us again next week for
another VOA Special English program
zh: 另一个美国之音慢速英语节目
